### Tender Notice

#### Invitation to Qualify

**Tender Reference:** WS3814160032
**Publication Date:** January 4, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** January 23, 2023, 14:00:00
**Amendment Number:** 2
**Amendment Date:** January 19, 2023

### Project Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO), jointly with the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG), invites contractors to qualify for a procurement opportunity to provide radar antenna replacement services at six marine communication and traffic service (MCTS) base stations in Southern British Columbia.

**Scope of Work:**

The successful contractor will be required to replace outside plant radar antenna systems at four existing CCG sites in Southern British Columbia. Additionally, the contractor will have the option to provide services for the replacement of radar antenna systems at two other sites, Mount Parke and Mount Ozzard.

**Scope Includes:**

* Removal and disposal of existing radar pedestals and hardware
* Installation of new steel radar pedestals and mounting hardware
* Installation of new radar antennas, transmission lines, power cables and associated fixtures

**Background:**

The current radar systems at the CCG MCTS base stations are nearing the end of their lifespan. The replacement of these systems is necessary to maintain the effectiveness of the Vessel Traffic Management System (VTMS). This system plays a critical role in the safe navigation of marine vessels.

**Trade Agreements:**

This procurement is subject to trade agreements as outlined in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Tender Closing Date:** January 23, 2023, 14:00:00
